text: Little Alberta is a mountain located east of Habel Creek in the Canadian Rockies of Jasper National Park. The mountain was named in 1984 after nearby Mount Alberta (). The Alpine Club of Canada (ACC) operates the Lloyd MacKay Hut on a rocky shoulder of Little Alberta. ==References== ==External links== * Little Alberta in the Canadian Mountain Encyclopedia. Category:Two-thousanders of Alberta Category:Mountains of Jasper National Park Category:Winston Churchill Range
title: Little Alberta
